lootbeams.config.item.allItems.descripti:
If all Items Loot Beams should be rendered.
 Has priority over only_equipment and only_rare.
lootbeams.config.item.blacklist.descript:
Registry names of items that Loot Beams should NOT render on. This has priority over everything.
 You can also specify modids for a whole mod's items.
lootbeams.config.item.onlyEquipment.desc:
If Loot Beams should only be rendered on equipment.
 (Equipment includes: Swords, Tools, Armor, Shields, Bows, Crossbows, Tridents, Arrows, and Fishing Rods)
lootbeams.config.item.onlyRare.descripti: If Loot Beams should only be rendered on items with rarity.
lootbeams.config.item.whitelist.descript:
Registry names of items that Loot Beams should render on.
 Example: "minecraft:stone", "minecraft:iron_ingot", 
You can also specify modids for a whole mod's items
lootbeams.config.main.beamFadeDistance.d:
How close the player has to be to no longer see the beam.
 (note: smooth fade distance is 1 unit)
lootbeams.config.main.beamHeight.descrip: The height of the Loot Beam.
lootbeams.config.main.beamRadius.descrip: The radius of the Loot Beam.
lootbeams.config.main.beamRenderDistance:
How close the player has to be to see the beam.
 (note: ItemEntities stop rendering at 24 blocks, so that is the limit for beams)
lootbeams.config.main.beamYOffset.descri: The height of the Loot Beam.
lootbeams.config.main.colorOverrides.des:
Overrides an item's beam color with hex color.
 Must follow the specific format: (registryname=hexcolor) Or (#tagname=hexcolor).
 Examples: "minecraft:stone=#00FF00", "#minecraft:piglin_loved=gold". This also accepts modids.
lootbeams.config.main.enderRarityColor.d: If beams should be colored the same as the Items rarity.
lootbeams.config.main.renderNameColor.de:
If beams should be colored the same as the Items name (excludes name colors from rarity). 
This has priority over render_rarity_color.
lootbeams.config.nametags.alwaysDrawRari:
Define on which items smaller tag should render on. 
Example: "#minecraft:music_discs" will render song name as smaller tag. 
Be aware that text rendered is a tooltip line below the name so it wont work well with multiple enchantments (though 1 enchantment looks pretty good)
lootbeams.config.nametags.borders.descri: Render nametags as bordered. Set to false for flat nametag with background.
If a smaller tag should be rendered under with DMCLoot rarities.
lootbeams.config.nametags.lookSensitivit: How close the player has to look at the item to render the nametag.
lootbeams.config.nametags.rarities.descr:
Define what the smaller tag should render on. 
Example: "Exotic", "Ancient". 
The string supplied has to be the tooltip line below the name. 
This is really only used for modpacks.
lootbeams.config.nametags.render.descrip: If Item nametags should be rendered at all.
lootbeams.config.nametags.renderOnlook.d: If Item nametags should be rendered when looking at items.
lootbeams.config.nametags.renderStackCou: If the count of item's should also be shown in the nametag.
If rarities should ignore color and render as white 
(This is really only used for modpacks)
lootbeams.title: Loot Beams
